learnings.title: Async Update Structure (RFCs, ADRs, Status)
learnings.bodyMd:
# Async Update Structure (RFCs, ADRs, Status)

## Overview
Structure async docs for fast scanning and durable decisions: concise summary, options, decision, and rationale.

## Key Concepts
- RFC: context, proposal, alternatives, impact.
- ADR: decision, context, consequences.
- Status updates: TL;DR, progress, risks, asks.

## Examples
- 1‑page RFC with clear decision date and reviewers.
- ADR template in repo for architecture choices.

## Common Pitfalls
- Wandering narratives in async docs.
- Missing explicit decision/ask.

## Summary
Use lightweight, consistent templates so readers can decide quickly and trace decisions later.

learnings.title: Threading, Tagging, and Findability
learnings.bodyMd:
# Threading, Tagging, and Findability

## Overview
Make async conversations searchable and coherent with clear subject tags, threading, and consistent locations.

## Key Concepts
- Subject tags: [Decision], [Action], [FYI].
- Single source of truth: link to canonical docs.
- Threading: reply‑in‑thread for continuity.

## Examples
- Email subject: [Decision] Vendor selection by Fri.
- Slack: keep discussions in the original thread with doc links.

## Common Pitfalls
- Fragmented discussions across channels.
- Vague subjects that hinder search.

## Summary
Standardize tags and threads, and point to canonical sources so information stays organized and retrievable.

learnings.title: Clear Writing for Global, Async Audiences
learnings.bodyMd:
# Clear Writing for Global, Async Audiences

## Overview
Write for non‑native speakers and skim reading: short sentences, concrete language, and unambiguous CTAs.

## Key Concepts
- Plain language; avoid idioms.
- One idea per paragraph; labeled bullets.
- Explicit asks with owners and dates.

## Examples
- Replace idioms ("move the needle") with clear terms ("increase by 10%").
- Action lists with owners and due dates.

## Common Pitfalls
- Culture‑bound metaphors.
- Dense paragraphs and mixed topics.

## Summary
Favor clarity over flourish. Make actions explicit and language simple for global comprehension.

learnings.title: Decision Logs and Traceability
learnings.bodyMd:
# Decision Logs and Traceability

## Overview
Maintain a lightweight decision log so teams can trace why and how choices were made.

## Key Concepts
- Decision ID, context, date, decider.
- Links to RFC/ADR and related threads.
- Review windows and change history.

## Examples
- Shared decision log in the wiki with filters.
- ADRs linked from PRs/issues.

## Common Pitfalls
- Decisions lost in chat history.
- Logs without owners or updates.

## Summary
Centralize decisions with minimal fields and links. Keep it current so new teammates can onboard quickly.

learnings.title: Documentation Hygiene and Review Cadence
learnings.bodyMd:
# Documentation Hygiene and Review Cadence

## Overview
Keep docs fresh and trustworthy with simple ownership and periodic reviews.

## Key Concepts
- Page ownership and last‑review dates.
- Archiving stale content.
- Review cadence by criticality.

## Examples
- Ownership footer and "review by" banners.
- Quarterly reviews for core processes.

## Common Pitfalls
- Dead wikis with outdated guidance.
- No owner to maintain pages.

## Summary
Assign owners, set review cycles, and prune aggressively to keep async knowledge bases reliable.
